revised_title: Female Mice's Olfactory Preferences for Uninfected Males
tldr: Female mice can distinguish between the odours of parasitized and non-parasitized males and show a preference for non-parasitized males. This preference may help reduce parasite transmission and play a role in mate selection. The study shows that female mice investigate and spend more time around the odours of non-parasitized males, indicating their preference.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior
